result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Scott Eliason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Scott Eliason is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Scott Eliason was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Daniel Scott Eliason was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation.
Defendant is entitled to 7 days credit under 973.155.
Defendant remanded into custody.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF216.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF216.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Defendant to participate in Restorative Justice Program.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

miscConds.notes:
* Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*Undergo AODA assessment within 45 days and shall follow all recommendations for treatment and shall complete treatment, including aftercare, successfully.
* Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
* Cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or correctional program as directed by DOC and complete any recommended treatment successfully. 
* Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
* Subject to random UA's and PBT's. 
* Follow all rules and regulations required by supervising agent and pay supervision fees.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Berhow, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Daniel Scott Eliason appeared. ADA Correll states there is an agreement. Ct 1 deferred for one year, probation for Ct 2 (absolute sobriety and AODA assessment conditions apply) Ct 3 dismissed.   

Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads N/C to Cts 1 and 2 in 15CF216. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 1 and 2 in 15CF216. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 3 in 15CF216. Crt orders: 
-Deferred Agreement approved for Ct 1
-Ct. 2 sentence withheld, 1 year probation. 
Conditions are:
-Orders 45 days jail STAYED, Huber granted
-AODA assessment to be done within 45 days
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Any other evaluations or programs that Agent deems necessary, 
-Court Costs, apply bond
-DNA surcharge.
